keyword: calories in tacos from jack in the box
title: Calories in Tacos from Jack in the Box
meta_description: Discover calories in tacos from Jack in the Box, including full nutrition for a standard 2-taco serving, macros, sodium, and preparation tweaks.
h1: Calories in Tacos from Jack in the Box
assumptions: Standard regular Jack in the Box tacos (small, deep-fried, with seasoned beef, cheddar cheese, lettuce, and taco sauce; no modifications).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, portion size, and customizations. Values based on official data; check Jack in the Box app or menu for latest.

quick_answer.text: Two Jack in the Box tacos have ~280 kcal, 14 g fat, and 14 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with menu info.

tweaks.label: Add extra taco sauce (1 packet per taco)
Vegetarian version (swap beef for beans per taco)

faqs.q: How many calories in one Jack in the Box taco?
What are the macros for tacos from Jack in the Box?
faqs.a: For two tacos: 26 g carbs, 14 g protein, 14 g fat (4 g saturated).

faqs.q: Are Jack in the Box tacos high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, two tacos have ~640 mg sodiumâ€”watch if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: How do Jack in the Box tacos compare to homemade?
faqs.a: They're fried and smaller, with higher sodium but similar calories to basic beef tacos.

faqs.q: Can I get lower-calorie tacos at Jack in the Box?
faqs.a: Opt for no sauce or cheese to reduce by 20-40 kcal per taco; check for veggie options.
